p: Besides the flavonoidic fraction, leiocarposide (25 mg/kg, i.p.) was also shown by A. Chodera et al. (1985) to have diuretic activity, equivalent to about 75% of the furosemide effect [ 9, 130]. The same authors have demonstrated that the i.p. route results in higher efficacy (about 30%) than the oral route, that it has a slow onset (around 5 h), and it lasts for up to 24 h [ 9, 119, 131]. The aglycone part of the glycoside (leiocarpic acid) is devoid of diuretic activity (at the same dose, 25 mg/kg i.p.) [ 9, 132].
